bug.summary: Issue using step argument in wandb.log()
bug.description:
Weights and Biases version: 0.9.2 Python version: 3.5.2 Operating System: Linux
<denchmark-h:h3>Description</denchmark-h>
Metric logging is always delayed by 1 step when using the step= argument in wandb.log(). I realize this was an issue in Jupyter notebooks, but it still an issue in ordinary Python scripts. I guess the current workaround is to not set the step at all, and log a custom step value, but I still feel like this step issue should be fixed in the near future. Please refer to the below code to reproduce this issue. <denchmark-h:h3>What I Did</denchmark-h>
<denchmark-code>import wandb import time
def main(): wandb.init(name='test', project="arbitrary_project", entity="numpee") for i in range(10): val = {'val': i} wandb.log(val, step=i) print("logged") time.sleep(60)
if __name__=="__main__": main() </denchmark-code>

Hey <denchmark-link:https://github.com/numpee>@numpee</denchmark-link> , step is used to determine when to "commit" a step. We should be commiting the final step when the process exits, it looks like that may be a bug. If you want the step to "commit" you can pass to your call to wandb.log. You should only do this if you don't intend to add other metrics to the current step, which in your example looks to be the case.

<denchmark-link:https://github.com/vanpelt>@vanpelt</denchmark-link> Great! I didn't know there was a argument. What I can do now is call all the for the current step, then pass an empty dictionary and commit the results. This seems to work now :) For reference, the changed code would be: <denchmark-code>import wandb import time
def main(): wandb.init(name='test', project="universal-segmentation", entity="numpee") for i in range(10): val = {'val': i} wandb.log(val, step=i) print("logged") # More wandb.log() calls here if needed wandb.log({}, step=i, commit=True) time.sleep(60)
if __name__=="__main__": main() </denchmark-code>
